ioRequire
description:
Require proxy to use alias shortcut in require function. 
Juste run the function to active the proxy.

name: engine
description:
Get the engine used for your command line tool, will be the parent process. If you want to
to create you're own follow the contribution guide

name: parseArgv
description: Parse node js process.argv array to an object

return.description: [Object with path, cmd and options sort out]

name: argv
description: Get Argv and parse argv if it's the first argv is called

name: inModule
description: Check if the class has been initialize into a module

name: isEngineProcess
description: Test if a specifique path is come from the engine

return.description:
Return true if the path come from 
                         the engine

name: currentPath
description: Get the path directory where the current command is run

name: globalPathFolders
description: Get an array of all the global path folder

return.description: Array with all the folder names

name: pathToIoFile
description:
Get the path to a Io root file from a given folder. 
This function will search in all the parents folder
to return the first file it find.

params.name: pathTo
params.description: The path where you want to start the research

return.description: return true if a root file's founded

content:
## Installation
Prerequisites: Node.js (>=6.x, 8.x preferred)

    $ npm install -g iorizon-cli

## Usage
Run init command to make your current folder working with Iorizon. Will ask you some question to initialize your project correctly. Add a io.json file to the root of your current project.

    $ io init


Run io command to know what you can do in the current directory.

    $ io


Run alias command to know map all the aliases you've access in your project. Aliases ares shortcut name you can call in your Io.json configuration file or just to copy-paste in your terminal to access a folder quicker

    $ io alias
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "iorizon-cli",
  "version": "1.4.12",
  "description": "Command line tools to set workflow",
  "main": "bin/lib/Io.js",
  "author": "djokone@tim.potter@wanadoo.fr",
  "license": "ISC",
  "scripts": {
    "test": "nyc mocha",
    "report": "nyc instrument ./test ./output",
    "debug": "mocha",
    "testing": "mocha -w test/envSpec.js test/*Spec.js --reporter mochawesome",
    "snyk-protect": "snyk protect",
    "snyk-prepare": "npm run snyk-protect"
  },
  "preferGlobal": true,
  "bin": {
    "iorizon": "bin/iorizon",
    "io": "bin/iorizon"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+ssh://git@github.com/djokone/Iorizon-Cli.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/djokone/Iorizon-Cli/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/djokone/Iorizon-Cli#readme",
  "dependencies": {
    "chalk": "^2.3.0",
    "cli-table-redemption": "^1.0.1",
    "commander": "^2.11.0",
    "cross-spawn": "^5.1.0",
    "file-exists-promise": "^1.0.2",
    "font-ascii": "^1.1.16",
    "fs": "0.0.1-security",
    "lodash": "^4.17.4",
    "pretty-print": "^1.1.0",
    "shelljs": "^0.7.8",
    "stacktrace-js": "^2.0.0",
    "write-json": "^2.0.0",
    "snyk": "^1.67.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "chai": "^4.1.2",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-publish-markdown-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "mocha": "^4.1.0",
    "mochawesome": "^3.0.1",
    "nyc": "^11.4.1",
    "sinon": "^4.1.4"
  },
  "snyk": true
}
name: package.json
